page.title: 05Prendergast Superstition
page.content: Behind Prendergast Church is a winding lane leading to Prendergast Place; from this runs a narrow lane called the{"PIGS' TROUGH"}which was formerly called "Pixies' Trough"...... ...the story grew up that many people were led over the country_side and then lost by the Pixies............... ...the name came from{"PYX"}which is a box which was carried to the Church, holding the Holy Bread; a{"TROUGH"}was the name for a narrow alley. {!! THE LOCAL GHOST !! { * THE WHITE LADY of the GHYLL * ...who is said to float along the foot path in Prendergast Place. In a battle her husband was killed. She comes back each evening, waiting for her husband; sometimes she brings a child; at other times she just comes alone............ ...she is very SAD...and in the end... !she just{** DISAPPEARS **}in the air!
